name: Hilton Innsbruck

reviews.title: Centrally Located – Average Hotel
reviews.text: The well located hotel in Innsbruck is within walking distance of the old town and pedestrian shopping areas. It is easy to get to via car and parking in the underground car ramp is a breeze. We were kind of excited to have a casino for entertainment, but it was a joke with few gaming tables and just plain small. The room itself was of average size, furnishings and amenities. It is about what I expect from an average Hilton property. The internet was reasonably priced at just $12.50 euro per day which is cheap compared to most of our other hotels in Switzerland and Austria.

Stayed three nights in September. Hotel is one of the tallest buildings in Innsbruck. Therefore, if you get a room on a high floor (probably anything above the 7th floor is good) you will have a nice unobstructed view of the city, the valley and the mountain. Room was modern, pleasant, and always very clean. Staff was nice. accommodating, and always happy to help. Breakfast was good and breakfast staff was attentive, however, breakfast selections were always the same every day and that got a bit old after three days. I would definitely consider this hotel again when I go back to Innsbruck.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at the Hilton for one night end of September, as she booked it on expedia and although wanted to change her plans, found that the booking was non-refundable or transferable.
reviews.title: Below average, but still OK

likes.disliked: — our non-smoking room was smokey, and location for dinner/nightlife

reviews.text: We only used it as a place to sleep, and did not go to the restaurant, workout facility, etc.
reviews.title: Superb hotel

reviews.text: However, my review on the room...
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best hotel in Innsbruck.......good rooms,great staff and possibly the best breakfast on any hotel in Europe!!!!
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Innsbruck!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its location is great offering many choices of what to do but walk around Innsbruck and enjoy Austrian hospitality.
reviews.title: Great hotel - convenient location

reviews.text: Must do.....dine out at the Golden Adelar,a 600 yo restaurant!
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: The Hotel has parking at a cost but everything s within walking distance
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: Tip.....avoid Sundays unless you want to sleep in....almost everything is closed in Innsbruck!
reviews.title: Not So Good

likes.disliked: — The room and very smokey lobby.

reviews.text: Unfortunately, I seem to have only bad experiences with Hilton reception staff. This is the 3rd time I've stayed at a Hilton hotel for business, and again the reception staff was not only incompetent but downright rude! The last third of our business group was told at check-in that they didn't have any non-smoker rooms left, even though we had booked them and received a confirmation from the hotel that they were available. The reception staff tried to blame everything on a colleague who wasn't on duty at that time and then became ruder by the minute. They said we could, however, fill in a form to have the window fully opened but then it turned out they couldn't find that form... At check-out they tried to charge the individuals for their rooms even though our stay was already paid for by the travel agency... On the up side the restaurant staff were extremely competent and friendly, and the food itself was extraordinarily good. The staff responsible for the conference rooms were also very capable. The rooms are very large, the view is great, and the location of the hotel is quite perfect as it's only a 2 minute walk into town.
reviews.title: The usual...

reviews.text: What you would expect, everything was very good. The only complaint is that you would think they would invest in better shower curtains. Had wonderful views on the mountains from our room.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.text: My family and I have just returned from spending 9 days at the the Hilton Innsbruck, and we were extremely satisfied in every respect. We chose the Hilton for our Christmas through New Years vacation after having read that the rooms were among the largest in Innsbruck. With 3 young adult children staying in one room, spaciousness was important. My request to stay on an upper floor in non-smoking rooms was honored. As soon as we arrived we were greeted enthusiastically and told that our rooms were ready, although we were early. Thoughout the next 9 days, we consulted the reception staff, and all of our numerous inquiries were answered with patience and considerable knowledge. The staff made a number of restaurant reccommendations which turned out to be quite good and gave us advice about ski slopes, the hospital, and surrounding sights.
reviews.title: Hotel exceeded expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were quite comfortable and very clean. Because of the breathtaking views of the mountains, the rooms seemed even more inviting and bright.
reviews.title: Nice stay at the Hilton Innsbruck

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel, though not in Old Town, was great. The ski bus has a stop in front of the hotel, and the rental shop for skis is nearby as is the train station. The five minute walk to Old Town was interesting with a diversity of shops and restaurants. It was actually a relief to be removed from the most congested part of the historic area.
reviews.title: good location great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the most delightful aspects of our stay was the large breakfast. The hostess and waitstaff greeted us by name each day and often stopped to chat with our family. Fresh squeezed orange juice, made to order waffles and egg dishes, fresh fruit, cheeses and pastries made breakfast something to look forward to.
reviews.title: Pretty decent hotel

description: Honoured with the certificate of excellence for the year 2011 Hilton Innsbruck is a central high-rise hotel surrounded by the majestic Tyrolean Alps. The contemporary hotel is located on a quiet street beside the picturesque Old City, close to the Triumphal Arch or the shopping street Maria-Theresien-Strasse. Hilton Innsbruck features the city’s largest conference facilities, catering for up to 300 people. The newly built restaurant (opening: December 2011) KONRADS Austrian steaks serves delicious seasonal dishes with ingredients from traditional local farms and prime beef from the Alps. Offering wonderful views of the mountains, Hilton Innsbruck is an ideal choice for any visit to Tyrol, whether for business reasons or to enjoy the numerous leisure possibilities nearby.
